introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.content: These Terms of Use ("Terms") govern access to and use of the decentralized storage service offered by Hashguard ("the Service"). By registering for or accessing our Service, you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you do not agree to these Terms, you must not use our Service.

serviceAccess.title: 2. Access to the Service
serviceAccess.content: The Hashguard Service allows users to store files in a decentralized manner across a network of nodes. Access to the Service is provided subject to your compliance with these Terms.

userObligations.title: 3. User Obligations
userObligations.content: As a user of Hashguard, you agree to: Provide accurate and complete information when registering for the Service. Not use the Service for illegal, fraudulent, or abusive purposes. Comply with all applicable laws and regulations related to the use of the Service. Not attempt to compromise, alter, or interfere with the operation of the Service or the underlying infrastructure.

dataUsageAndRetention.title: 4. Use of Service and Data Retention
dataUsageAndRetention.content: Data Storage: By using Hashguard, you agree that your files will be stored on a decentralized network distributed across various nodes. Your data will be stored securely, and in the event of a deletion request, a period of 18 months will be required for complete erasure of your data from all nodes in the decentralized network. Data Deletion: You can request the deletion of your personal data at any time. However, please note that it will take 18 months for the data to be fully erased from all nodes of the decentralized network. This delay is necessary due to the decentralized nature of data storage. Encryption: Your data is encrypted to ensure confidentiality and security during storage. Only you hold the private key required to decrypt your files. Decentralized Storage and Distribution: By using the Service, you acknowledge and accept that your data will be fragmented, encrypted, and distributed across various nodes within the decentralized network.

dataOwnership.title: 5. Data Ownership
dataOwnership.content: You are the sole owner of your files and data. Hashguard has no ownership rights over your stored files and agrees not to access your data without your explicit consent. By using Hashguard, you retain full control over your data and have the ability to manage its deletion or sharing according to your needs.

consent.title: 6. Consent to Data Collection and Retention
consent.content: By using the Service, you consent to the collection and retention of your personal information in accordance with our privacy policy. We only collect data necessary to manage your account and provide the Service, including your email address.

liabilityLimitation.title: 7. Limitation of Liability
liabilityLimitation.content: Hashguard commits to making every effort to ensure the availability and security of its services, but cannot be held liable for interruptions, data loss, or indirect damages resulting from the use of the Service, including losses related to network or server outages. Hashguard shall not be liable for failures caused by force majeure events, including technical incidents, cyberattacks, or network failures.

termsModification.title: 8. Modification of Terms
termsModification.content: Hashguard reserves the right to modify these Terms at any time. Any changes will take effect upon the publication of the new Terms on our website. We encourage you to regularly review these Terms to stay informed of any updates.

intellectualProperty.title: 9. Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.content: The Hashguard Service and all components thereof (including but not limited to software, algorithms, logos, and trademarks) are protected by intellectual property rights and are the exclusive property of Hashguard. You agree not to reproduce, distribute, or use these elements without prior authorization.

termination.title: 10. Termination
termination.content: You may terminate your Hashguard account at any time by contacting us through the user interface or by email. Upon termination, all your data will be deleted from our system in accordance with our data retention and deletion policy.

gdprRights.title: 11. GDPR User Rights
gdprRights.content: In accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), you have the following rights regarding your personal data: Right of access: You may request to view the data we hold about you. Right to rectification: You may correct or complete your information if it is inaccurate. Right to erasure: You may request the deletion of your personal data (see the data deletion section). Right to data portability: You may request your data in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format. Right to object: You may object to the use of your data for marketing purposes or other non-essential uses.

dataBreachManagement.title: 12. Data Breach Management
dataBreachManagement.content: In the event of a data security breach, Hashguard commits to notifying affected users within 72 hours in accordance with GDPR requirements. Corrective measures will be implemented to limit the impact of the breach and prevent recurrence.

dataSecurity.title: 13. Data Security
dataSecurity.content: Hashguard implements end-to-end encryption protocols to ensure that your data remains private and secure during decentralized storage. Each file is fragmented and encrypted before being stored on the network nodes, so that no entity, including Hashguard, can access your data without your private key.

privateKeyDisclaimer.title: 14. Disclaimer in Case of Private Key Loss
privateKeyDisclaimer.content: Hashguard implements security measures to protect your personal data and files. However, you are solely responsible for managing your private key used to access your data. In the event of loss or compromise of your private key, Hashguard cannot be held liable for unauthorized access to your data or file loss. It is your responsibility to keep your private key safe and not share it with unauthorized third parties. If you lose your private key, you may permanently lose access to your data, and Hashguard cannot recover your files due to the decentralized and secure nature of the storage system.

generalDisclaimer.title: 15. General Disclaimer
generalDisclaimer.content: Hashguard shall not be held liable for data loss, service interruptions, or technical failures related to the operation of the decentralized network, human error, or malicious attacks beyond our control, such as server outages, network failures, or communication issues related to the storage infrastructure.

onboardingPolicy.title: 16. Onboarding Policy and Free Usage Conditions
onboardingPolicy.content: Users subscribing to a freemium plan (e.g., the Discovery offer) acknowledge that storage may be limited to a specific capacity. Hashguard reserves the right to modify or discontinue these free offers at any time with reasonable notice. Users must upgrade to a paid plan if their usage exceeds the limits of the free service.

internationalDataTransfer.title: 17. International Data Transfer Clause
internationalDataTransfer.content: By using the Service, you consent to the transfer of your data across geographical borders and its storage on nodes located in different jurisdictions, including outside the European Union. We commit to complying with appropriate legal mechanisms to ensure the security of your data during transfer, including Standard Contractual Clauses where necessary.

web3Acceptance.title: 18. Web3 Usage Acceptance Clause
web3Acceptance.content: By using Hashguard, you agree to participate in a decentralized storage system based on Web3 technologies, including blockchain, and understand that these technologies may present specific features and risks compared to traditional centralized solutions.

auditabilityTransparency.title: 19. Auditability and Transparency
auditabilityTransparency.content: We are committed to providing full transparency on how your data is stored, managed, and deleted. If you have questions or concerns about data integrity or the deletion process, you may contact us for detailed information on the security mechanisms in place.

governingLaw.title: 20. Additional Legal Provisions
governingLaw.content: These Terms are governed by French law. Any dispute related to the use of the Service shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the competent courts in Nantes, France.

contact.title: 21. Contact
contact.content: For any questions regarding these Terms of Use or to exercise your rights over your personal data, you can contact us at: Email: support@hashguard.io Physical address: 2 place Jean V, Office 3, 44000 NANTES
